alert.note: Alert for Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued October 11 at 2:33PM ChST until October 11 at 7:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CHST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CHST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, large breaking waves of 12 to 17 feet on west facing reefs and 10 to 15 feet on south facing reefs. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking of 10 to 13 feet on west facing reefs and 9 to 12 feet on south facing reefs * WHERE...South and west facing reefs of Tinian and Saipan. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 7 PM ChST this evening. For the High Surf Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 6 PM ChST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will gradually diminish as Super Typhoon Bolaven continues to move away from the local area.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
